result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M. Vines Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert M. Vines Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert M. Vines Jr. was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 117 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.   Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert M. Vines Jr.

records.addlTxt: Deceased - Status changed on 8-5-16
For Cts 2 3 and 4 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Conditions include serving 90 days in Co. Jail w/Huber commencing forthwith.  Credit for 117 days served if probation is revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
Atty:  W Michel.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Celebre's motion to withdraw as attorney for the def. for the reasons stated on the record is granted.  Public Defender to appoint new counsel for def.  Sentencing hearing remains on for 2/3/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
to Withdraw as Counsel and Affidavit of David E. Celebre.  (Hearing 1/14/16 at 8:40 a.m.)

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2, 3, and 4 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 2/3/16 at 10:00.  Defense motion to modify bond is denied.  Bond continued.
of David E. Celebre
to Modify Bond filed by Atty David Celebre.  (Hearing 12/17/15 at 9:45 a.m.)

Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br  8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

941.29(2)(a), 939.62(1)(b) Felon Possess Firearm - Repeater, 941.28(2), 939.62(1)(b) Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle  - Repeater, 946.49(1)(a), 939.62(1)(a) 2 Cts. Misd. Bail Jumping - Repeater
Bench Warrant canceled with Renee in Joint Services.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  (Court Reporter: S. Armbruster)  Clerk: PT
DE appears in court on 14CM133 & 15CM1073 and warrant is vacated in this file.  Court sets bond to a $10,000 Signature Bond w/ conditions and DE signs bond.  Change in court reporter to Court Reporter: R. Anderson).  DE has made a decision to enter a plea in 14CM133 & 15CM1073 and is no longer seeking a jury trial in those files today.  Court has been informed that DE was attempting to flee in this file before start of court today and DE states he was leaving to get food when he was here for trial in his other cases.  Court re addresses bond at this time and bond is increased to a $2000 Cash Bond w/ conditions that he shall not possess or consume alcohol or consume controlled substances without a prescription and no contact with Robert Coronado or Mike Aldrige or their residences.  DE is taken into custody. Preliminary Hearing before Comm. Mason on 10/21/15 at 10:15 AM.
